reviews.review_msg: I have taken a few courses with Prof Barraza in my four years here, and I don't regret any. While I have had classes I liked more, I have not found a style of lecturing I prefer over hers. In her four hour classes, it never feels too long, because she has a well structured lecture plan from lecturing, to class discussions, to group discussions. Fun

By far the best prof at SFU. As someone who hates reading, interesting class discussions and provided literature made me commit to being caught up with what is a LOT of reading. Maria is passionate about the topics she teaches but also to learn from her students and their ideas. Show up, don't be afraid to share, and you will enjoy her classes.

love love love. maria chose a great topic for WL103! would definitely consider reaching out early to see the topic prior to enrolling; this term was female-led literature, identity and motherhood which i could tell maybe bored some people thinking it'd be an easy A by just using sparknotes. amazing class discussions and class culture! she's a queen

Baddie prof with the best outfits. She's passionate, and a great first year teacher. 

(For WL103)

meant to review WL103 not WL303

Maria's interest and passion in the subject shows, lectures are interesting and engaging. She encourages the class to participate but she establishes the class as a safe space, so you're not scrutinized if you say the wrong answer, which is honestly really relieving if you're on the shy side like myself.

My favourite prof at SFU and this class was probably the best one I've taken in my 3 years here. Class discussions and material were relevant, connecting to real-world issues and complex ideas. She made content comprehensible and prompted us to fruitful conversations. She's helpful and provides guidance so long as you ask for it.
